}

Given a vector of numbers, return whether or not they are sorted
in ascending order. If vector has more than 1 duplicate of the same
number, return false. Assume no negative numbers and only integers.

Examples
is_sorted({5})  true
is_sorted({1, 2, 3, 4, 5})  true
is_sorted({1, 3, 2, 4, 5})  false
is_sorted({1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6})  true
is_sorted({1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7})  true
is_sorted({1, 3, 2, 4, 5, 6, 7})  false

#include<algorithm>

bool is_sorted(vector<int> lst){
    for (int i=1;i<lst.size();i++)

        if (lst[i-1]>lst[i])

    return true;
}

You need to return the sum of squared numbers in the given vector,
round each element in the vector to the upper int(Ceiling) first.

For lst = {1,2,3} the output should be 14
For lst = {1,4,9} the output should be 98

<|endoftext|>/*
The Brazilian factorial is defined as:
brazilian_factorial(n) = n! * (n-1)! * (n-2)! *... * 1!
where n > 0

For example:
>>> special_factorial(4)
288

The function will receive an integer as input and should return the special
factorial of this integer.
*/
#include<stdio.h>
using namespace std;
long long special_factorial(int n){
    long long fact=1,bfact=1;
    for (int i=1;i<=n;i++)
        fact*=i;
    for (int i=1;i<=n;i++)
        bfact*=i;
    return fact*bfact;
}
/*
The function will receive an integer as input and should return the factorial
of this integer.
*/

using namespace std;
long long factorial(int n){
    long long fact=1;
    for (int i=1;i<=n;i++)
        fact*=i;
    return fact;
}

Given two vectors operator, and operand. The first vector has basic algebra operations, and 
the second vector is a vector of integers. Use the two given vectors to build the algebric 
expression and return the evaluation of this expression.

The basic algebra operations:
Addition ( + ) 
Subtraction ( - ) 
Multiplication ( * ) 
Floor division ( // ) 
Exponentiation ( ** ) 

Example:
operator{"+", "*", "-"}
vector = {2, 3, 4, 5}
result = 2 + 3 * 4 - 5
=> result = 9

Note:
    The length of operator vector is equal to the length of operand vector minus one.
    Operand is a vector of of non-negative integers.
    Operator vector has at least one operator, and operand vector has at least two operands.

*/

#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
#include<algorithm>
#include<stdlib.h>
int do_algebra(vector<string> operato, vector<int> operand){
    vector<int> num={};
    vector<int> posto={};
    for (int i=0;i<operand.size();i++)
        posto.push_back(i);
    for (int i=0;i<operato.size();i++)
        if (operato[i]=="**") 
        {
        while (posto[posto[i]]!=posto[i]) posto[i]=posto[posto[i]];
        while (posto[posto[i+1]]!=posto[i+1]) posto[i+1]=posto[posto[i+1]];
        operand[posto[i]]=pow(operand[posto[i]],operand[posto[i+1]]);
        posto[i+1]=posto[i];
        }
    for (int i=0;i<operato.size();i++)
        if (operato[i]=="*" or operato[i]=="//") 
        {
        while (posto[posto[i]]!=posto[i]) posto[i]=posto[posto[i]];
        while (posto[posto[i+1]]!=posto[i+1]) posto[i+1]=posto[posto[i+1]];
        operand[posto[i]]=operand[posto[i]]*operand[posto[i+1]];
        posto[i+1]=posto[i];
        }
    for (int i=0;i<operato.size();i++)
        if (operato[i]=="+")
        {
        while (posto[posto[i]]!=posto[i]) posto[i]=posto[posto[i]];
        while (posto[posto[i+1]]!=posto[i+1]) posto[i+1]=posto[posto[i+1]];
        operand[posto[i]]=operand[posto[i]]+operand[posto[i+1]];
        posto[i+1]=posto[i];
        }
    for (int i=0;i<operato.size();i++)
        if (operato[i]=="-")
        {
        while (posto[posto[i]]!=posto[i]) posto[i]=posto[posto[i]];
        while (posto[posto[i+1]]!=posto[i+1]) posto[i+1]=posto[posto[i+1]];
        operand[posto[i]]=operand[posto[i]]-operand[posto[i+1]];
        posto[i+1]=posto[i];
        }
    for (int i=0;i<operato.size();i++)
        if (operato[i]=="/")
        {
        while (posto[posto[i]]!=posto[i]) posto[i]=posto[posto[i]];
        while (posto[posto[i+1]]!=posto[i+1]) posto[i+1]=posto[posto[i+1]];
        operand[posto[i]]=operand[posto[i]]/operand[posto[i+1]];
        posto[i+1]=posto[i];
        }
    return operand[posto[0]];
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Given a string 'text", return its md5 hash equivalent string.
If 'text" is an empty string, return None.

>>> string_to_md5("Hello world") == "3e25960a79dbc69b674cd4ec67a72c62"
*/

#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
#include<openssl/md5.h>
using namespace std;
string string_to_md5(string text){
    unsigned char md[16];
    if (text.length()==0) return "None";
    MD5_CTX c;
    int i;
   MD5_Init(&c);
   MD5_Update(&c, (unsigned char*)text.c_str(), text.length());
    MD5_Final(md, &c);
    string md5 = base64_encode(md);
    return md5;
}

>>> string_to_md5("Hello world") == "3e25960a79dbc69b674cd4ec67a72c62"
*/

#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
#include<openssl/md5.h>
using namespace std;
string string_to_md5(string text){
    unsigned char md[16];
    if (text.length()==0) return "None";
    MD5_CTX c;
    int i;
   MD5_Init(&c);
   MD5_Update(&c, (unsigned char*)text.c_str(), text.length());
    MD5_Final(md, &c);
    string md5 = base64_encode(md);
    return md5;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Return only positive numbers in the vector.
>>> get_positive({-1, 2, -4, 5, 6})
{2, 5, 6}
>>> get_positive({5, 3, -5, 2, -3, 3, 9, 0, 123, 1, -10})
{5, 3, 2, 3, 9, 123, 1}
*/

#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<float> get_positive(vector<float> l){
    vector<float> positive;
    for(int i = 0; i < l.size(); i++){
        if(l[i] > 0){
            positive.push_back(l[i]);
        }
    }
    return positive;
}

/*
Return only negative numbers in the vector.
>>> get_negative({-1, 2, -4, 5, 6})
{-1, -4, -6}
>>> get_negative({5, 3, -5, 2, -3, 3, 9, 0, 123, 1, -10})
{-5, -3, -3, -9, 0, 123, 1}
*/

#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<float> get_negative(vector<float> l){
    vector<float> negative;
    for(int i = 0; i < l.size(); i++){
        if(l[i] < 0){
            negative.push_back(l[i]);
        }
    }
    return negative;
}

/*
Return only numbers in the vector that are divisible by 3.
>>> get_divisible_by_3({-1, 2, -4, 5, 6})
{-1, 2, -4, 6}
>>> get_divisible_by_3({5, 3, -5, 2, -3, 3, 9, 0, 123, 1, -10})
{5, 3, -5, 2, -3, 3, 9, 0, 123, 1}
*/

#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<float> get_divisible_by_3(vector<float> l){
    vector<float> divisible_by_3;
    for(int i = 0; i < l.size(); i++){
        if(l[i] % 3 == 0){
            divisible_by_3.push_back(l[i]);
        }
    }
    return divisible_by_3;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Return median of elements in the vector l.
>>> median({3, 1, 2, 4, 5})
3
>>> median({-10, 4, 6, 1000, 10, 20})
15.0
*/

#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
#include<algorithm>
using namespace std;
#define MAX_SIZE 100
int median(vector<int> l) {
    int size = l.size();
    if (size % 2 == 0) {
        return l[(size / 2) - 1];
    }
    else {
        return (l[size / 2] + l[size / 2 - 1]) / 2;
    }
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Given vector of integers, return vector in strange order.
Strange sorting, is when you start with the minimum value,
then maximum of the remaining integers, then minimum and so on.

Examples:
strange_sort_vector({1, 2, 3, 4}) == {1, 4, 2, 3}
strange_sort_vector({5, 5, 5, 5}) == {5, 5, 5, 5}
strange_sort_vector({}) == {}
*/

#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<algorithm>
using namespace std;
vector<int> strange_sort_list(vector<int> lst){
    vector<int> out={};
    sort(lst.begin(),lst.end());
    int l=0,r=lst.size()-1;
    while (l<r)
    {
        out.push_back(lst.at(l));
        l++;
        out.push_back(lst.at(r));
        r--;
    }
    return out;
}
vector<int> strange_sort_vector(vector<int> lst){
    vector<int> out={};
    sort(lst.begin(),lst.end());
    int l=0,r=lst.size()-1;
    while (l<r)
    {
        out.push_back(lst.at(l));
        l++;
        r--;
    }
    return out;
}

#include<stdio.h>

int add(vector<int> lst){

<|endoftext|>/*
From a given vector of integers, generate a vector of rolling maximum element found until given moment
in the sequence.
>>> rolling_max({1, 2, 3, 2, 3, 4, 2})
{1, 2, 3, 3, 3, 4, 4}
*/

#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> rolling_max(vector<int> numbers){
    vector<int> out;
    int max=0;
    for(int i=0;i<numbers.size();i++){
        if(numbers[i]>max){
            max=numbers[i];
        }
    }
    for(int i=0;i<numbers.size();i++){
        if(numbers[i]==max){
            out.push_back(max);
        }
    }
    return out;
}

/*
From a given vector of integers, generate a vector of rolling minimum element found until given moment
in the sequence.
>>> rolling_min({1, 2, 3, 2, 3, 4, 2})
{1, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2}
*/

#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> rolling_min(vector<int> numbers){
    vector<int> out;
    int min=numbers[0];
    for(int i=0;i<numbers.size();i++){
        if(numbers[i]<min){
            min=numbers[i];
        }
    }
    for(int i=0;i<numbers.size();i++){
        if(numbers[i]==min){
            out.push_back(min);
        }
    }
    return out;
}

/*
From a given vector of integers, generate a vector of rolling sum element found until given moment
in the sequence.
>>> rolling_sum({1, 2, 3, 2, 3, 4, 2})
{6, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6}
*/

#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> rolling_sum(vector<int> numbers){
    vector<int> out;
    int sum=0;
    for(int i=0;i<numbers.size();i++){
        sum+=numbers[i];
    }
    for(int i=0;i<numbers.size();i++){
        if(numbers[i]==sum){
            out.push_back(sum);
        }
    }
    return out;
}

/*
From a given vector of integers, generate a vector of rolling average element found until given moment
in the sequence.
>>> rolling_avg({1, 2, 3, 2, 3, 4, 2})
{1.5, 2.5, 3.5, 4.5, 5.5, 6.5, 7.5}
*/

#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> rolling_avg(vector<int> numbers){
    vector<int> out;
    int sum=0;
    for(int i=0;i<numbers.size();i++){
        sum+=numbers[i];
    }
    for(int i=0;i<numbers.size();i++){
        if(numbers[i]==sum){
            out.push_back(sum/numbers.size());
        }
    }
    return out;
}

/*
From a given vector of integers, generate a vector of rolling median element found until given moment
in the sequence.
>>> rolling_median({1, 2, 3, 2, 3, 4, 2})
{2, 2.5, 3, 3.5, 4, 4.5, 5}
*/

#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> rolling_median(vector<int> numbers){
    vector<int> out;
    int sum=0;
    for(int i=0;i<numbers.size();i++){
        sum+=numbers[i];
    }
    for(int i=0;i<numbers.size();i++){
        if(numbers[i]==sum){
            out.push_back(sum/numbers.size());
        }
    }
    sort(out.begin(),out.end());
    return out;
}

/*
From a given vector of integers, generate a vector of rolling mode element found until given moment
in the sequence.
>>> rolling_mode({1, 2, 3, 2, 3, 4, 2})
{2, 3, 4, 2}
*/

#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> rolling_mode(vector<int> numbers){
    vector<int> out;
    int max=0;
    for(int i=0;i<numbers.size();i++){
        if(numbers[i]>max){
            max=numbers[i];
        }
    }
    for(int i=0;i<numbers.size();i++){
        if(numbers[i]==max){
            out.push_back(max);
        }
    }
    sort(out.begin(),out.end());
    for(int i=0;i<numbers.size();i++){
        if(numbers[i]==out[0]){
            out.erase(out.begin()+i);
        }
    }
    return out;
}

#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> rolling_variance(vector<int> numbers){
    vector<int> out;
    int sum=0;
    for(int i=0;i<numbers.size();i++){
        sum+=numbers[i];
    }
    for(int i=0;i<numbers.size();i++){
        if(numbers[i]==sum){
            out.push_back(sum/numbers.size());
        }
    }
    sort(out.begin(),out.end());
    for(int i=0;i<numbers.size();i++){
        if(numbers[i]==out[0]){
            out.erase(out.begin()+i);
        }
    }
    return out;
}

    }
    return out;
}
